name: Ipe.Language

unions.name: ExportItem
unions.comment: Each item can either be a function or a type. For functions, it's simple to export them: just type out their name. For types, they can export a different number of variants.

unions.name: ModuleExport
unions.comment: A module can export all of the functions and types inside of it, or it can export only some of them.

unions.name: Type
unions.comment:
Types can be:

  - generic: start with a lowercase letter and can have no arguments
  - records: named list of `Type`s
  - custom types: types with arbitrary `Type` arguments

unions.name: TypeExport
unions.comment:
When exporting a type, we can:

  - Export all variants
  - Export no variants (opaque types)
  - Export only some variants

aliases.name: ModuleDefinition
aliases.comment: The module definition is the first thing we see when reading an Ipe file. It's the root of the module definition tree, which tells us the module name and all the functions and types the module exports.

aliases.name: TypeConstructor
aliases.comment: A constructor needs a name, and can have any number of arguments, which can be generic or not.

aliases.name: TypeDefinition
aliases.comment: A type can have any number of type variables (which start with a lowercase letter), and it can have any number of constructors. It always needs a name
aliases.type: { typeName : String.String, typeVariables : List.List String.String, constructors : List.List Ipe.Language.TypeConstructor }

name: Ipe.Parser

values.name: moduleDefinition
values.comment:
Every Ipe file must start by defining a module. This function parses a module definition.

    -- Modules can expose some definitions
    module ModuleName exposing (OpaqueType, SemiOpaqueType(Variant1, Variant2), VisibleType(..), function)


    -- Or all of them
    module ModuleName exposing (..)

values.name: typeDefinition
values.comment:
Parses a custom type definition. You can give it type variables that start
with a lowercase letter. Each type constructor must start with an uppercase letter.

    type Price currency
        = Price Int

values.name: type_
values.comment:
Parse a type. Can be one of:

  - generic (a type that starts with a lowercase letter)
  - record (similar to JSON objects)
  - custom type (names that start with an uppercase letter and can have arguments)
